task.title: Ground the Circuit
task.shortdesc: Connect all ground points to eliminate noise and ensure proper signal flow by linking the volume pot lug to its casing, both pot casings together, and the volume casing to the output jack.

cmd.ph: Solder the 0.5-inch solid core jumper wire from lug 1 of the volume potentiometer to the back of the volume potentiometer casing.
Bend lug 1 back and solder it directly to the casing.

image.alt: Wiring diagram showing the ground connection from Lug 1 of the volume pot to the casing

step.cmd: Solder one black wire between the volume and tone potentiometer casings.
step.info: Use one of the black wires you cut earlier.

image.alt: Wiring Diagram showing the ground connection between the volume and tone pots

step.cmd: Solder the remaining black wire from the volume potentiometer casing to the sleeve lug of the output jack.
step.info: The sleeve lug is the largest terminal on the inside of the output jack.

image.alt: Wiring Diagram showing the ground connection between the volume pot casing to the output jack

result.p: The circuit is now fully grounded with all components connected to a common ground reference.
